text: Elm City Express is a men's soccer club based in New Haven, Connecticut that most recently competed in the National Premier Soccer League. The club's colors are blue and white, and plays its home matches at Jess Dow Field at Southern Connecticut State University. The ownership group of Elm City Express also owns and operates Clube Atlético Tubarão, a Brazilian soccer club based in Santa Catarina, which competes in the lower levels of Brazil's pyramid. ==History== Elm City Express was founded in 2017 by Zack Henry. In their inaugural season, The Express won the 2017 NPSL Championship by defeating Midland-Odessa FC 5-0 on August 12, 2017 at Reese Stadium in New Haven. In January 2019, Elm City announced they would be taking a hiatus for the 2019 season and Zack Henry would no longer be president of the team. ===Front office=== * Luiz Henrique Martins Ribeiro – vice president * Brian Neumeyer – general manager * Eric Da Costa – technical director ==Year-by-year== {| class="wikitable" !Year !Division !League !Record !Regular Season !Playoffs !Open Cup |- |2017 |4 |NPSL |9–1–2 |bgcolor="B3B7FF"|1st, Atlantic Blue Conference |bgcolor="FFEBAD"|National Champions |Did not enter |- |2018 |4 |NPSL |5-3-2 |4th, North Atlantic Conference |1st Round |3rd Round |} ==Honors== National Premier Soccer League *National Playoffs **Champions: 2017 *Northeast Region **Champions: 2017 *Atlantic Blue Conference **Champions: 2017 ==Notable players== *Joshua Calderón, defender; Puerto Rico men’s national team *Matt Jones; goalkeeper; assistant coach of the Quinnipiac Bobcats ==See also== * Hartford City FC ==References== ==External links== * Category:2017 establishments in Connecticut Category:Association football clubs established in 2017 Category:Defunct soccer clubs in Connecticut Category:National Premier Soccer League teams Category:Sports in New Haven, Connecticut
title: Elm City Express
